lines.text: Biggest boar in the world, I bet.
All depends on how you spell it.
Abel Frake, I am not putting liquor in my cooking!
Speaking of affairs, Eleanor's on the phone.
Christmas, why didn't you say so!
Ohh... but the house you live in...
It's got to be the same. No old clapboard shingle business. There is a new kind of plastic, pre-fabricated job. I want you to see it at the catalog home.

Sure, but whats more important it's termite proof. Wait 'til you see it, they tell you how to furnish it too. No rugs or carpets, there just dust collecters... Linolium through the whole house, wait until you see the pictures, it's sleek and smooth easy to keep clean... well it's like every room in the house was a Bathroom!
I don't know what's gotten into you lately. All you do is sit around and mope.
I don't sit around and mope.

[tasting the mincemeat]
Doesn't taste like Grandma Stiches.
I was only talking. I couldn't marry anybody but you. Ever!

[leaving the fair]
I never want to see another fair.

[putting a drunk Wayne to bed]
One shoe off and the other shoe off. Diddle diddle dumpling my son John. Hey, that don't rhyme like it used to.
